content.full_text:
Petition of John Hines and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court, February
               1836 We your Petitioners, anxious that our public roads should be so improved by Bridges
               and otherwise  in^a^manner to render them comfortable and useful to the increasing wants of the Public—hereby
               pray your Honors to Grant and apply so much of the County Revenue as will build a
               suitable Bridge OverRock Creekwhere theLewistonandSpringfieldRoad now crosses the same— We appeal the more confidently, from the fact that a comparative
               small Sum will answer this demand of the Public Good— and that no work of the kind
               and cost can subserve more interests and conveniences than the proposed one—
paragraphs:
Petition of John Hines and Others to the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court, February
               1836

We your Petitioners, anxious that our public roads should be so improved by Bridges
               and otherwise  in^a^manner to render them comfortable and useful to the increasing wants of the Public—hereby
               pray your Honors to Grant and apply so much of the County Revenue as will build a
               suitable Bridge OverRock Creekwhere theLewistonandSpringfieldRoad now crosses the same— We appeal the more confidently, from the fact that a comparative
               small Sum will answer this demand of the Public Good— and that no work of the kind
               and cost can subserve more interests and conveniences than the proposed one—
